intro: Adnaria ciliosa, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plumbaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant features bristly, hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Adnaria ciliosa typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
